Summary: venus-like, white light with cloud around it changing into light, cloud below then light dissapeard then cloud dissapates
trends: There have been 21 other sightings in Bethlehem
There were no other sightings in Bethlehem on or around September 19th 2009
divs: sighting detailsi was at friends' house for cook-out and quoits. at approximate time soon after sunset when the sky was just becoming totally dark, i looked up at the sky and panned my view to venus. i noticed a light just about thirty degrees down and to the right (two fingerwidths at an armslenth) of venus. i noticed the light because i often look at the sky at night and knew that whatever the light was, it wasn't a regular star or planet or whatever it was. i noticed that the light seemed either stationary or moving at a slow steady pace compaired to venus. i also semi-imedeatly noticed a haze or cloudiness surrounding the light which makes me think that the light was from a craft like a helicopter searchlight, but slow steady motion. by this point in recolecting i alerted a new friend of mine who was standing close by and we both looked at the light, i said, " man you have got to check this out..." we looked at the light and at this point (two other friends look and see it as well. as we all four of us were looking at the light, it changed and the cloudy haze of light seemed to be reorienting itself below the light and formed a cone of white light below the light and then separated into two beams\cones of light and diminished somewhat while the light\source of light seemed to turn up out of view while still the cones of light still dissipating at a slower rate than the light itself. during when the light shifted it seemed to be moving gradually upward very gradually to less gradually until it disapeared. later that night a friend who was riding his bike from easton to bethlehem ( where i was) said that someone called him while he was on his way from easton telling him that 'he had to see what was up in the southern sky...' . he said that four friends in easton saw this light, he saw it and i and three others in bethlehem saw the light and thru comparing stories the light seemed to be coming from due south from easton and south south west from bethlehem. afterward i felt like, "what was that?", "never saw that before", "cool"... billy hartnett
